page.title: 04General Questionnaire Data.
page.content: The following points emerged from a general questionnaire distributed in Mattishall on July 10th.1985: The majority of inhabitants came here from Norwich,many others came from Essex.The main reason for coming here was the husband's job.Most people have lived here between ten and twenty years,a few have lived here all their lives.Almost all the residents like the village,because it is pleasant, friendly and convenient for Norwich and Dereham.Not many complaints were registered,but litter and dog faeces were mentioned.Very few residents actually work in the village,those that do are mostly women (housewives) working (often part-time) as cleaners,shop-assistants etc.The village is seen as having changed greatly with new housing development recently."No more,"say the residents!
